author: Muscat Daily
title: ODB to extend financing to more sectors introduce new products and services
text:
(MENAFN - Muscat Daily) Muscat- Oman Development Bank (ODB) held a joint seminar with the Public Establishment for Industrial Estates (PEIE) at Knowledge OasisMuscat on Wednesday. The seminar introduced a range of products and services designed to finance development projects in the sultanate. Eng Ahmed Khalifa al Hajri corporate branch manager at ODB gave a presentation on the bank's services while Khamis bin Hamad al Sabahi senior manager (corporate credit) answered questions of participants. 

Eng Hajri said 'ODB has taken steps to extend its financing services to more sectors including logistics. The bank is also mulling the introduction of new products such as leasing. As a state-owned development bank ODB has been nurturing the SME sector in the sultanate with its expertise in industrial finance. 

'With 18 branches and 250 committed employees the bank has been able to fulfil its duties as a crucial facilitator in the development sector.' Eng Hajri added 'The bank covers designated sectors including tourism industries education healthcare agriculture livestock and fisheries information technology consultancies and workshops. 

'It has been a strong partner in enhancing local production and in-country value. Last year ODB's gross loans portfolio touched RO116.61mn and the industrial sector made up the major share of the loan portfolio at 26 per cent.'
